description: Change of use of rear building from A1 (Retail) to D1 (Health Centre) GP Surgery; parking; two storey 'link' extension; and external alterations to be used in conjunction with frontage premises 71-73 The Broadway, Southall granted planning consent under P/2004/0568.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | No development shall take place until details of cycle parking have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the building, and retained permanently.  REASON:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with Adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' policy 9.6. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings, details of car parking provision, including a disabled car user parking, in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works commence on site.  Such provision to be brought into use prior to the first occupation of any part of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking and pedestrians within the site adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' policy 9.1. | Prior to first occupation of the development, details of a travel plan showing how the travel demands for staff and patients will be addressed shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works commence on site.  Any measures proposed in the Travel Plan shall be implemented prior to first occupation and retained thereafter.  REASON: To minimise car use and promote alternative modes of travel for staff and patients to and from the site in accordance with the Adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' policies 2.1 and 9.1. | Details of access for people with disabilities shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of development and the approved scheme shall be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with the Council's Adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' policies 4.1 and 4.3. | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that any machinery audible outside the premises will be designed to satisfy acoustic standards.  The approved insulation shall be implemented before the development is commenced and retained permanently thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of nearby occupiers in accordance with Council's Adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 4.11. | Details of composite sound reduction indices of the building envelope to protect the proposed development against road and traffic noise shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development on site.  Such measures as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and retained permanently.    REASON:  To ensure that the development provides adequate internal working conditions in accordance with Adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' policies 4.1 and 4.11. | The use permitted shall not operate outside 0800 to 2200 hours Monday to Friday, 0800 to 1400 hours on Saturday and not at any time on Sundays or Bank or Public Holidays.  REASON:	In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with Adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' policy 4.1. | The premises shall be used as a health centre and for no other purpose within Class D1 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Should the health centre use cease, the existing retail element of the premises shall revert to A1 retail use.    REASON:  To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers in the locality, and to protect the long term vitality of the town centre in accordance with Adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' policies 4.1 and 7.3. | The implementation of this use as a GP Surgery (D1) shall only be in conjunction with the use of the ground floor of 71-73 The Broadway, Southall, approved ref:P/2004/0568 granted on 30/09/2004 and shall not be used independently.  Reason:  The application accommodation provides shared ancillary and staff accommodation for the adjoining health centre use  (granted planning consent under planning ref:P/2004/0568 dated 30/09/2004) accessible during the same hours of operation to provide intergrated health and GP accommodation to serve the local community in accordance with Council's Adopted UDP policies 4.1, 8.1, 8.9. | All existing and proposed windows in the west elevation of the building shall contain only obscure glass, and shall be permanently fixed shut.  A sample of the obscured glass, no smaller than 300 mm square shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the sample thus approved.  The details so approved shall be retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring propertiesin accordance with Adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' policy 4.1.
